text: pandas have the bodies of carnivores but
they don't eat like them instead they
die and almost exclusively on bamboo
herbivores have twisty guts and
microbial helpers to get the most from
their veggies the question is how do
pandas get the energy they need from
their restricted diet the answer they
don't move around too much when
scientists measured the energy
expenditure of pandas they found it was
extremely low wild pandas expand about
45 percent of the energy expected from a
comparable mammal pandas also have
slimmed down organs with lower energy
demands and lower levels of thyroid
hormones which slows their metabolism
now you know the next time you see a
panda relaxing in the Sun slowly eating
bamboo they have a good reason
